pr_title: Fix merging of single value headers

timeline.message: Fix merging of single value headers

timeline.author: spfink

replies.bodyText: Not really needed, I just needed to able access the list from the tests, but I can just copy them there.
replies.author: dagnir

timeline.message: Remove some headers defined as lists

timeline.bodyText: We're now introducing an implicit 'priority' in the sense that the last header 'wins'. Can we add a comment about that?
timeline.author: millems

replies.bodyText: Sure, i'll add a note on the setters in the Client/Request override configuration.
replies.author: dagnir

timeline.bodyText:
Should we disallow (or log) when there are multiple values specified in the same headerValues for a single-header?
It's a bit weird if I add multiple content-types at the request level, but it just takes the last one.
timeline.author: millems

replies.bodyText:
I went back and forth with this. Alternatively what do you think about keeping all the values in the current list, but not merging them with the previously seen list?
e.g.
"FooHeader" set by marshaller -> "a"
"FooHeader" override on client -> ["b", "c"]
"FooHeader" override on request -> ["d", "e", "f"]
"FooHeader" on the wire -> ["d", "e", "f"]
replies.author: dagnir

replies.bodyText: After discussing offline, went with the above solution.
replies.author: dagnir
